intro: Beauverdia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of tubular, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun. Beauverdia subsessilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
